study_plan_entry.title: Molecular pathology and therapy of neurodegenerative diseases (EDNE)

free_text.Learning outcomes: To introduce the student to the processes of Neurodegeneration in the CNS and the potential therapies envisaged today and tomorrow to ameliorate of cure neurodegenerative diseases in the CNS.
free_text.Content: 1) The latest discoveries on the molecular pathology of Parkinson's, Huntington's and Alzheimer's diseases and Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis will be presented.[br/][br/]2) Emphasis will be given to the genetic aspects of each disease, i.e. the concepts of negative gain of function of mutated proteins, the role of aggregatopathy and specificity of the pathogenesis.[br/][br/]3) The potential therapeutic approaches, including the delivery of neurotrophic factors, gene therapy and the use of stem cells for brain repair will be discussed.[br/][br/]4) Concepts such as apoptosis and necrosis in the CNS will be presented[br/][br/]5) New technological approaches to unravel the sequence of events of neurodegenerative diseases will be discussed, including, DNA arrays, transgenic animals, functional neuroimaging
